de.wwu.muggl.configuration
Class Globals

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.configuration.Globals

public final class Globals
extends java.lang.Object

Singleton class that holds global constants and some variables that are used in the application for configuration purposes. Most of them refer to either logging, the design of GUI windows or version information.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-08-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

SAFETY_SLEEP_DELAY

public static final int SAFETY_SLEEP_DELAY
Base delay for an invocation of sleep() in milliseconds. At some point, a delay is needed due to threading.

REDUCE_SAFETY_SLEEP_DELAY

public static final int REDUCE_SAFETY_SLEEP_DELAY
Smaller base delay for an invocation of sleep() in milliseconds. At some point, a delay is needed due to threading.

logger

public final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
General Logger: FATAL: Condition that leads to the halting of the application. ERROR: Condition that leads to the halting of parts of the application, while continuing is possible. WARN: Something unexpected happened, but continuing is possible. INFO: General information, probably success in finishing some task. DEBUG: Detailed information about what will be or was done. TRACE: Very detailed information about what will be or was done.

execLogger

public final org.apache.log4j.Logger execLogger
Execution Logger: FATAL: Error in the virtual machine which forces halting of the application. ERROR: Error in the virtual machine which forces halting of the virtual machine. WARN: Unexpected condition which needs handling (possibly resulting in a halting of the virtual machine). INFO: General information, probably success in finishing some task. DEBUG: Detailed information about what will be or was done. TRACE: Very detailed information about what will be or was done.

guiLogger

public final org.apache.log4j.Logger guiLogger
GUI Logger: FATAL: Error on the GUI which forces halting of the application. ERROR: Error or Exceptions on the GUI which forces the closing of a window. WARN: Not used by this logger. INFO: General information about GUI events. DEBUG: Not used by this logger. TRACE: Not used by this logger.

solverLogger

public final org.apache.log4j.Logger solverLogger
Solver Logger: FATAL: Not used by this logger. ERROR: Not used by this logger. WARN: Solving failed for an unexpected reason. INFO: General information about solving events. DEBUG: Detailed information about the solvers work. TRACE: Really detailed information about the solvers work.

symbolicExecLogger

public final org.apache.log4j.Logger symbolicExecLogger
Symbolic Execution Logger: FATAL: Error in the symbolic execution which forces halting of the application. ERROR: Error in the symbolic execution which forces halting of the execution. WARN: Unexpected condition which might lead to results being blurred. INFO: General information about steps being taken for the symbolic execution. DEBUG: Detailed information about steps being taken for or conclusions gained by the symbolic execution. TRACE: Very detailed information about steps being taken for or conclusions gained by the symbolic execution.

Method Detail

getInst

public static Globals getInst()
Getting the only instance of this class.

Returns:
The only instance of this class.

changeLogLevel

public void changeLogLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
Setter for the log level. This Method will alter the value in the Constants class. Do NOT call this method from within the private constructor (it will attempt to generate logging output and hence request the logger which will lead to an initialization error).

Parameters:
level - The new log level.

getLoggingLevel

public org.apache.log4j.Level getLoggingLevel()
Return the currently set logging level. As it is not encouraged to change the level for single loggers, getting the level of the main logger should be suitable in most cases.

Returns:
The Level of the main logger.

changeLoggingLayout

public void changeLoggingLayout()
Open a new logfile and apply the currently set Layout to its appender.

continueWithNewLogfile

public void continueWithNewLogfile(boolean changeLayout)
Try to generate the name for the new log file and open it. If this fails, logging stops. If it succeeds, a message is written to the current log file. New entries will be written to the new log file, which becomes the current one.

Parameters:
changeLayout - If set to true, a the Layout of the appender will be changed.

setLoggingMessagesEscaping

public void setLoggingMessagesEscaping(boolean value)
If the logging format is HTML, toggle the escaping of values. If HTML logging is disabled it will have no effect, especially it will NOT be changed.

Parameters:
value - If set to true, message escaping will be enabled, otherwise it will be disabled.
See Also:
HTMLLayoutEscapeOption
